summary: 5. things you didn’t say at all for winterironmachine please
question: 5. things you didn’t say at all for winterironmachine please
answer:
Rhodey doesn’t say anything at all about it. When James flirts with them, when they respond. He doesn’t really say anything serious, just light flirtation back and jokes about life and couples and romance. James watches himself, because they’re–them. He’s allowed only some comments, some looks, but nothing else. 

Nothing’s gonna come out of it. Because he’s fucked up, and Rhodey probably knows that. Does know that. Probably knows that this is the closest James will ever get to having anything romantic. Tony too. 

Until he doesn’t know if nothing will come out of it. Until Rhodey invites James to a dinner with them, and Tony grins a little bit more, gets a little bit more flirty. 

He wears his blue shirt. 

“If you need to impress them, wear the blue,” Steve says. “Sam says to tell you that you kind of only suck, but that Rhodey and Tony are lucky to have dinner with you.” 

“I don’t know if this is romantic or not,” James mutters. 

“Oh right, because we all get invited to their penthouse for casual dinners,” Steve says sarcastically. “Don’t panic text me in the bathroom, Sam and I are going out for dinner. Panic text Sharon instead.” 

“Will do,” Bucky says, already pulling up her number. 

Sharon also agrees to the blue shirt, pleased that Steve can show actual taste. She makes James laugh, and think that maybe this won’t be a dinner where they tell him that he’s a failure or anything. He doesn’t know why he’s so…anxious. 

The dinner looks very nice. Tony’s wearing a nice apron that has the decoration of one of Monet’s paintings, and Rhodey’s wearing a casual shirt with a blazer over it. 

“Looks like Tony’s style invaded yours,” James says. “I like it.” 

“Figured you wanted to see some dress up,” Rhodey says. “Also, Tony said I couldn’t wear a t-shirt.” 

“You’d look sad, dearest,” Tony calls from the kitchen. “Jim dear, please get water. James, don’t help him. His puppy dog eyes are a certain weakness, but they bring nothing but hard work. Which you and I are far too pretty for.” Rhodey laughs, getting the water glasses. 

“You want wine, babe?” 

James blinks for a moment. Rhodey’s looking at him, but he said endearment. 

“Uh, yeah. Red?” 

“We’re not heathens. Well, usually. Sometimes white comes out, but that’s only for rough lab days.”  

They sit at the table, and there’s an awkward silence for a moment before Tony blurts out: 

“What dinosaur could you conceivably beat in a fight?” 

“Tony, what are you–” 

“Stegosaurus,” James says. 

(Without prompting, fuck they’re gonna know he’s thought about this before, shitttttttt) 

“Why?” Rhodey asks, blinking. “And why do you and Tony think about these things?” 

“Jurassic Park,” Tony adds solemnly. “Also, I liked reading dinosaur books as a kid. I could and would beat a pterodactyl’s ass.” 

They talk more about funny childhood stories–Rhodey laughs so hard he snorts when Bucky tells them about how Steve got hung out to dry once by his mother–and then the serious topic comes up. 

“So, I think you should know that both me and Tony like you,” Rhodey says. “More than the friendship stage. So we were kind of wondering if you were…the same. Obviously if you’re not, then that’s cool. We still have dessert and a movie open.” 

“You’re serious?” James asks. “Me? You like me?” 

“Yes, that’s generally why we hosted a dinner and used wedding china,” Tony said. “Which, speaking of, we need to change the pattern. Your sister doesn’t have taste, Rhodey.” 

“Only with dishes. Besides, we got three toasters from your side of the family.” Tony grins, but turns back to James. 

“But seriously, consider the offer. We’d like to…date you. If you want that. If not, no pressure.” 

“Yeah,” James says. “I mean ‘yes’ because ‘yeah’ sounds casual, and this isn’t casual and also the dessert smells great and wow am I rambling?” 

“Yes,” Rhodey answers simply. “You are.” 

“I…I can’t believe you guys like me.” 

“You are a very likable person,” Tony says. “Soft and good at cuddling. Rhodey and I did an experiment.” 

“Wouldn’t mind being the experiment again if it means cuddling,” James says to laughter. 

They share dessert and a movie, and James just can’t stop grinning. They like him. Ain’t that a kick in the head.

blog.name: twentysomethingloser92
blog.title: Random Fanfictions of a Twenty Something
blog.description: Michelle// I'm an adult// And a parent// and fandom trash.

summary: 16 + Tony Stark
question: 16 + Tony Stark
answer:
“Move your ass, or stay out of my way”


“Move your ass, or stay out of my way,”

Those words hurt more than they probably should have, but you stood in your position, your arms crossing over your chest.


You stared down your friend, his face showing one of anger and sadness. He went to push past you but you pushed him back just as hard.



“I can’t let you do this Tony,” You said in a low voice, swallowing back tears as you knew what he was about to do, “I won’t let you do this,”



The older man gave you an exasperated sigh, “You don’t get a say in this,”



“Pepper wouldn’t want you to do this,” You explained as you watched his face crumble that little bit more.



He looked down before looking back up at you, “If Pepper cared she would have stayed,”


“You know for a fact that isn’t true. She loved you Tony. And time and time again you did stupid shit and hoped for a miracle that you made it out alive. Is it any wonder she left? She wanted a family with you. But how could she have had that when she was always stressing about you?!” You retaliated as the first tear fell down Tony’s cheeks.

“So it was okay for you to always go out there and sacrifice yourself? Did you not care about how anyone would have reacted if you died?”

“I don’t have people who love me the way Pepper loved you-”

“I do!” Tony’s shout echoed throughout his workshop. You were stunned into silence. He let out a sigh of exasperation and ran his hands through his hair, “Do you think when I saw you and Parker go into that spaceship that it was just Peter I was trying to rescue? Did you think when I was fighting Thanos after you were laying on the ground bleeding out from fighting him, that I was doing it because I wanted too? No. If I didn’t fight him and keep him away from you he would have killed you. You say you have no one that cares about you but you have me. You always have me,”

“Tony-” You whispered brokenly. Your shoulders slumped as you took a step forward, placing your hand on his arm, “I’ve loved you for years. Since I joined the Avengers. But you and Pepper, you’re soulmates,”

“I love you,” He whispered back.

“And you love Pepper as well,” He wouldn’t argue with you, because he loved Pepper so much, you could see it in his eyes.

“What do we do?”

“I watch you get married and have babies and become a magnificent father,” You let out a small smile as Tony looked down.

You both knew that you were too broken to be in a relationship with each other, you both knew that if you ended up in a relationship it would be created on toxic foundations full of self-sacrifice and sex.
The love you had for each other was built through war. A war that you both fought and lost, it was built through days on a spaceship with no one else for comfort, it was built through mourning and tears.

“I’m not letting you do this by yourself though,” You gave him a tight-lipped smile, “I know once you’ve made up your mind about something you won’t give up on it. So, I’ll help,” You let out a large breath, “What do you need me to do?”

Tony gave you the first smile you had seen in months.

“I can’t let you do this Tony,” You said in a low voice, swallowing back tears as you knew what he was about to do, “I won’t let you do this,”



The older man gave you an exasperated sigh, “You don’t get a say in this,”



“Pepper wouldn’t want you to do this,” You explained as you watched his face crumble that little bit more.



He looked down before looking back up at you, “If Pepper cared she would have stayed,”


“You know for a fact that isn’t true. She loved you Tony. And time and time again you did stupid shit and hoped for a miracle that you made it out alive. Is it any wonder she left? She wanted a family with you. But how could she have had that when she was always stressing about you?!” You retaliated as the first tear fell down Tony’s cheeks.

“So it was okay for you to always go out there and sacrifice yourself? Did you not care about how anyone would have reacted if you died?”

“I don’t have people who love me the way Pepper loved you-”

“I do!” Tony’s shout echoed throughout his workshop. You were stunned into silence. He let out a sigh of exasperation and ran his hands through his hair, “Do you think when I saw you and Parker go into that spaceship that it was just Peter I was trying to rescue? Did you think when I was fighting Thanos after you were laying on the ground bleeding out from fighting him, that I was doing it because I wanted too? No. If I didn’t fight him and keep him away from you he would have killed you. You say you have no one that cares about you but you have me. You always have me,”

“Tony-” You whispered brokenly. Your shoulders slumped as you took a step forward, placing your hand on his arm, “I’ve loved you for years. Since I joined the Avengers. But you and Pepper, you’re soulmates,”

“I love you,” He whispered back.

“And you love Pepper as well,” He wouldn’t argue with you, because he loved Pepper so much, you could see it in his eyes.

“What do we do?”

“I watch you get married and have babies and become a magnificent father,” You let out a small smile as Tony looked down.

You both knew that you were too broken to be in a relationship with each other, you both knew that if you ended up in a relationship it would be created on toxic foundations full of self-sacrifice and sex.
The love you had for each other was built through war. A war that you both fought and lost, it was built through days on a spaceship with no one else for comfort, it was built through mourning and tears.

“I’m not letting you do this by yourself though,” You gave him a tight-lipped smile, “I know once you’ve made up your mind about something you won’t give up on it. So, I’ll help,” You let out a large breath, “What do you need me to do?”

Tony gave you the first smile you had seen in months.

tags: kind of like how this turned out
summary: 18. things you said when you were scared for winteriron please!
question: 18. things you said when you were scared for winteriron please!
answer:
James Barnes doesn’t get scared often. Doesn’t have to, what with all the things that have happened to him. He gets concerned, angry, irritated, but never scared. Usually, he’s the one that they call when they want someone else to feel fear. 

He feels wary all the time. Not scared, just…wary. He always looks out for strangers, makes sure the team stays safe. 

Especially Tony. Tony Stark is one of the better parts of the future. He’s full of vitality, full of passion. He rants to him about how stupid the board is, how awful Pepper is being by scheduling him from being away from New York literally all next month, and anything else that comes to mind. 

They explore movies they’ve never seen together, try new recipes. Currently, Tony’s on a cobbler kick, so they’ve had peach and blueberry so far, blackberry planned later. 

And then. 

He goes missing. 

Bucky doesn’t feel scared. He’s not scared, he’s just fucking pissed. 

Until he sees the pictures. They get sent in the mail, the stamp being a yellow rose. Friendship. What a sick joke. 

The kidnapper wants a suit. Of course they do, what else would they want? But they write that they will keep inflicting damage onto Dear Anthony until they get what they want. 

That scares James. More than anything else. He’s losing sleep trying to find Tony, trying to find anything to get to him. 

“You need sleep,” Natasha says, walking into the room. James is surrounded by papers and videos, research of any enemy that has a connection to flora or just hell…anything. “You know you do, no matter the enhancements.” 

“I’ve done more with less,” he snaps back. 

“But Tony is more important to you. You know that. Everyone knows that. So get your head out of your ass and realize that it doesn’t matter if you can’t give your best.” He notices that she has dark circles too. Her eyes aren’t as guarded now. She values Tony as one of her important friends. James shouldn’t have…he knows. 

“Fine.” 

Sleep is plagued with nightmares. Of smiles turning bad, light situations going to worse themes. But he gets the damn sleep, so that’s fine. 

They find a connection, and they let Winter Soldier loose. He grins a little; they have no idea who the hell they threatened. They don’t have the man power necessary to subdue someone–something–like him.

Tony’s lying down on the floor, coughing. He sounds weak. James drops his knife, rushing to his side. 

“Tony, oh…shit.” 

“You didn’t start the…recipe without me, did you?” Tony asks, coughing weakly. “Because I have some blackberries already, and–” 

“You dork,” James says. His voice is tight. “You…oh god. I’m so glad you’re here now. I’m glad you aren’t…” 

“Six feet under? Me too, my will states cremation.” 

Things will be okay. 

Something happens. Tony’s closer, more intense. It’s not until a late night of nightmare-fueled baking that he says anything. 

“James, I think you should know I love you,” Tony says. As if it’s not the most wonderful thing to hear in the world. “So if you wanna go to dinner or something, I’m down. Except that I have a meeting late on Wednesday, but who likes dates on Wednesday?” 

James still doesn’t feel scared after that. He’s caring, he’s comforting, but he’s not scared. Winter Soldier took care enough of that.

He feels wary all the time. Not scared, just…wary. He always looks out for strangers, makes sure the team stays safe. 

Especially Tony. Tony Stark is one of the better parts of the future. He’s full of vitality, full of passion. He rants to him about how stupid the board is, how awful Pepper is being by scheduling him from being away from New York literally all next month, and anything else that comes to mind. 

They explore movies they’ve never seen together, try new recipes. Currently, Tony’s on a cobbler kick, so they’ve had peach and blueberry so far, blackberry planned later. 

And then. 

He goes missing. 

Bucky doesn’t feel scared. He’s not scared, he’s just fucking pissed. 

Until he sees the pictures. They get sent in the mail, the stamp being a yellow rose. Friendship. What a sick joke. 

The kidnapper wants a suit. Of course they do, what else would they want? But they write that they will keep inflicting damage onto Dear Anthony until they get what they want. 

That scares James. More than anything else. He’s losing sleep trying to find Tony, trying to find anything to get to him. 

“You need sleep,” Natasha says, walking into the room. James is surrounded by papers and videos, research of any enemy that has a connection to flora or just hell…anything. “You know you do, no matter the enhancements.” 

“I’ve done more with less,” he snaps back. 

“But Tony is more important to you. You know that. Everyone knows that. So get your head out of your ass and realize that it doesn’t matter if you can’t give your best.” He notices that she has dark circles too. Her eyes aren’t as guarded now. She values Tony as one of her important friends. James shouldn’t have…he knows. 

“Fine.” 

Sleep is plagued with nightmares. Of smiles turning bad, light situations going to worse themes. But he gets the damn sleep, so that’s fine. 

They find a connection, and they let Winter Soldier loose. He grins a little; they have no idea who the hell they threatened. They don’t have the man power necessary to subdue someone–something–like him.

Tony’s lying down on the floor, coughing. He sounds weak. James drops his knife, rushing to his side. 

“Tony, oh…shit.” 

“You didn’t start the…recipe without me, did you?” Tony asks, coughing weakly. “Because I have some blackberries already, and–” 

“You dork,” James says. His voice is tight. “You…oh god. I’m so glad you’re here now. I’m glad you aren’t…” 

“Six feet under? Me too, my will states cremation.” 

Things will be okay. 

Something happens. Tony’s closer, more intense. It’s not until a late night of nightmare-fueled baking that he says anything. 

“James, I think you should know I love you,” Tony says. As if it’s not the most wonderful thing to hear in the world. “So if you wanna go to dinner or something, I’m down. Except that I have a meeting late on Wednesday, but who likes dates on Wednesday?” 

James still doesn’t feel scared after that. He’s caring, he’s comforting, but he’s not scared. Winter Soldier took care enough of that.

blog.name: tinydragontony
blog.title: TinyDragonTony
blog.description: This is a side blog dedicated to the frostrion fanfiction "Adventures of Tiny Dragon Tony and His Treasure (Loki)" found on AO3. Simply put, I don't have time to write full length fanfics so I want to compile a collection of snapshots into the lives of tiny dragon Tony and his ever sweet yet mischievous lover Loki. So, if that tickles your fancy, why not give us a follow? Or, better yet, follow us on AO3 for update notifications!

summary: Tony’s Favorite Photographs
title: Tony’s Favorite Photographs
body:
Tony kept his three favorite photographs hidden within his office desk, tucked away in a thumbprint-locked compartment that only he had access to. He didn’t examine them often, but it was during occasions like these, when Loki was off in some far-off realm gathering materials for his studies and the ache in Tony’s chest was too much to bear, that he pulled them out. He leaned back in his chair and held one up, a selfie – or, more specifically, Loki’s first attempt at a selfie on the phone Tony gifted him during the initial weeks of their relationship. It was a blurry shot of Loki’s face. Only half of it, caught in the motion of a quick head turn. The effect was an almost watercolor-like blurring of his features, softening them. Tony could barely make out the green of Loki’s eyes. The only thing that was in relative focus was the one perfect curl that framed Loki’s face, the one Tony loved to tug before Loki could bat his hand away, laughing as it sprung back into shape. Grinning, he set the photo aside.

The second was one he took of Loki. And how could he not? The jerk looked so devilishly handsome sitting in the little reading nook he had carved out for himself when he moved into the tower. Loki’s legs were pulled up close to his body and a light knit blanket draped over his thighs. Sunlight streamed in through the windows and caught green and purple and blue in Loki’s hair, shades Tony had never seen before but ones that the camera picked up marvelously. There was a thick tome levitating in front of Loki’s view, written in a language Tony didn’t recognize as one from Earth, and clasped in his grasp was a large mug – tea, if Tony remembered correctly, and a gross one, too. Loki had convinced him to try it, promised it was mellow, then laughed as the overbearing sweetness practically gave him an immediate cavity. Loki even had a subtle smirk on his face in the photo, as if he could hear Tony’s current thoughts. Smug bastard. He flipped to the next photo, eager to rid the taste from his mouth.

The last photo, his favorite of the three, was one JARVIS captured while he and Loki were unaware. They were gathered in an exhausted heap on the rug in front of the fireplace, wings and tails twined around each other in an intimate draconian embrace. They had been chasing each other around his penthouse. He grinned, thinking of the scene they must have made. Tiny dragons, one red, one oily black, bounding and tumbling over couches and chairs and tables, nipping at tails and pinning each other to the ground and rolling around in play. He wondered if JARVIS recorded any of it.

Looking back at the photo, Tony took in Loki’s dragon form. The transformation was a recent development, though one that didn’t require too much prompting from Tony. A good dose of dragon eyes and a pleading head tilt was all it took for Tony to convince Loki to shift for him. And he was – is – stunning. He was more serpent-like in appearance compared to Tony. Where Tony was square and angular, Loki was sleek and elegant. His scales, a reflective black, shifting with those same shades found in his sunlit hair, even caught some of the red from Tony’s scales. His tail, like his body, was long and slender, lacking spines. Similarly, forked onyx horns laid back against his head and two black tendrils extended from his snout, sleepily curling in the air. Tony traced his nail over the green edge of Loki’s wing as it draped over his back. Tony had smiled then and he smiled now as he recounted the possessive gesture, one he wondered if Loki knew the true meaning of. Even if he didn’t, warmth bloomed in Tony’s chest.

“Sir,” JARVIS said, and Tony looked up, a soft smile on his face. “Loki has returned.”

With a final stroke over Loki’s tiny cheek, Tony replaced the photographs and locked them away before he shot up, smile broadening on his face, as he went out to welcome him home.

For more dragon times, follow: https://archiveofourown.org/works/17533676/chapters/41312006

summary: THE SHADOW [Pietro Maximoff x Reader ]
title: THE SHADOW [Pietro Maximoff x Reader ]
body:
SUMMARY:  Y/N and her twin had known the Maximoff twins long enough but, He couldn’t stop his feelings what he felt for her when he saw her for the first time. Will he tell her that he loves her before it’s too late? 

A/N: I actually had this idea to write on Wattpad but heh, thinking about to publish the book one day. This will be a big or small series so be PREPARED. And I want you to send me a reblog or let me in the comment if you want me to continue with this series! Plus, this will just be an introduction. also, I suck at Summaries so, I will tell you that 

WARNINGS: None, I guess? 

Don’t plagiarize my work, please!

You walked into a room with Lizzie as you saw Wanda in the corner as you saw her looking at someone. As you stepped closer and stand next to her as Lizzie was on her left side. You saw Tony Stark shaking with fear as you looked at him with curiosity. 

You felt Pietro standing next to you while the all of you watching Tony Stark shaking with fear. You had known them long and they became a family to both of you and your sister. 

You hid behind a tree as you saw the Avengers fighting while Pietro had run off and knocked them off to the ground. The Maximoff twins didn’t want you and your sister to be when they were fighting against the Avengers because they wouldn’t let you be hurt. 

But you didn’t care because you had your powers and you were capable to protect yourself. You saw Wanda sneaking up to Clint as she tried to make him have a vision of his worst fear but, she wasn’t fast enough because she got electricity by one of his arrows. 

Your eyes widened in fear when you saw her fall to the ground and shaking consciously. ‘’Wanda!’’ you screamed her name as Clint turned his head to you when he heard you call her name. He was about to shoot at you but you were faster. You clenched your hand into a fist and raised it up in front of your face.

You saw him scream in pain as you made him a Pain Infliction. Pietro ran towards Wanda and lifted her up to carry her a safe place. ‘’Clint? Are you Okay?’’ Natasha’s voice was heard in his earpiece worriedly as she heard him scream in pain. 

You saw your twin as you walked over to her and went after Pietro and Wanda. Clint opened his eyes only to find you gone and only left a heavy headache. 

‘’I’m fine, the twins aren’t alone what we thought they were  ’’

blog.description: icon by starkxs. name is jess, please send in a full prompt! thanks so much for stopping by, I appreciate it!

tags: they kiss each other and steve is nice!
summary: stony, 14, “things you said after you kissed me”?
question: stony, 14, “things you said after you kissed me”?
answer:
Steve’s not really a talker. Tony knows this. Steve prefers to act rather than speak, and Tony’s not really going to argue, especially when Steve’s so good at actions. 

But when they’re alone, Steve will talk a bit. Just a few compliments here and there. Some fun little anecdotes about his day. Tony loves it, honestly. He doesn’t tell Steve he does, just hums and works his way around.  

The kisses are always spread out over the day, never at once. That’s how they prefer it. 

It starts in the morning. Steve wakes Tony up at six in the morning–a shitty time, but Tony does put up with it for kisses–and he says “Good morning, love. I’m going on my run, I’ll text you when I’m coming back.” And then kiss. Tony likes it. 

He can’t go back to sleep, and he loves to make breakfast. So he’ll usually get started on Steve’s breakfast, which is basically cooking for two. Four slices of toast, four eggs, two strips of bacon, (he’s not making more, Steve doesn’t need that much) and a bowl of fruit. He also makes coffee, which is more for him. 

At around six forty, Steve will come back, shower, and drop a kiss on Tony’s temple. 

“Run was good. I got to pet three dogs.” 

“More than yesterday, babe, good for you.” Steve grins, nabbing his plate. “No more bacon?” 

“No more bacon,” Tony says. “If I have to watch what I’m eating, so do you. Besides, you know you can make more, lazy bones.” Steve rolls his eyes. He pours the coffee for Tony, with the required tablespoon of cream and another of sugar. 

The next kiss is when Steve drops by SI on his lunch break. The new PA, Gilda, lets him in with no thought. Just waves him through. 

“Missed you,” Steve says. “Brought lunch.” Usually, it’s something he made before he went to work. Sometimes it’s something from a shop that Tony likes. Either way, wonderful. 

“I saw you at breakfast.” 

“And yet, not until lunch. Time differences, babe.” Tony likes the pet names. Steve lives for them. He uses the usual ones–honey, babe, sweetheart, darling, love, all of that. Tony loves it. It means more to him than he knows, perhaps because Steve doesn’t say things unless he really means them. 

Lunch passes quickly, with Steve being late and the suit ruffled a little bit always. Natasha says she and Maria always make fun of him. 

Next kiss is usually a text from either of them. Both love their work, and so Steve may be staying thirty minutes later or Tony will. (They set a limit, obviously. Whether or not it’s actually followed is usually up to the urgency.) Steve or Tony will text that they’re late, a kiss at the end. Still nice, if a bit artificial. 

Dinnertime is Steve’s time to cook. He loves doing it. He usually sets Dean Martin’s music up, singing alone to the music as Tony teases him over the pronunciation of some of the Italian. Steve gets a kiss and a question about work. 

“Work is fine, just working with new recruits,” Steve says. “Some of ‘em are really nice, so I’m sending them Hill’s way.” 

“You can see her name, Steve. Just because she likes to act like she knows all doesn’t mean she does.” 

“She knows about the incident of us and office room J.” 

“Shit.” 

Steve laughs, shaking out some more seasoning for the meat. He hums along to some Sinatra as he drops the broccoli onto the cutting board. 

“What do you want me to do, honey?” 

“Nothing,” Steve says. “Nothing except give me a kiss. You got breakfast. I got dinner.” 

“And you get me lunch. You technically get two meals, which means I have to make it up somehow.” 

“Love doesn’t get made up, it just exists,” Steve reminds him, dropping another kiss on him. “And you are by far the best existence to me.” Tony snorts, rolling his eyes. 

“You geek, quit being so sappy. People might think we’re in love or something.” 

“Oh we’ve had no idea!” Bruce calls from the hallway. “No idea that you two are the grossest married couple in existence!” Steve lets out a bellowing laugh, head thrown back. 

“Thanks Bruce!” he yells back. 

They eat dinner together, talking about the rest of their day. Tony had a couple of international meetings which went well. Tony’s working on renewable energy for other countries, running into some problem with oil companies and zoning. 

“Want me to fight the oil companies?” Steve says. “I can do that.” Tony laughs. 

“As much as I would love that, I don’t want to bail you out of jail. Besides, we have a movie premiere to go to next week, and you still need to get fitted for the suit.” Steve makes a noise of disapproval. 

“Why can’t I just wear one from my closet? I doubt people would notice if it was the same black one.” 

“This one is a bit more…daring. How do you feel about purple?” 

“…interested. Fitting tomorrow then? I’m off work at two.” 

“Definitely.” 

The rest of the night is pretty boring, as far as nights go. Tony listens to a message Peter sent him about his Spider-Man patrol, and Steve texts Bucky about the mission he’s on. It must not be too high-stakes, because he sends snapchat videos of Clint dancing to Whitney Houston in the middle of a blizzard. 

“They’re both ridiculous,” Tony says. He’s wearing readers while he has one of his cheesy books with him. He and Pepper have a reading group, and right now they’re on murder-mystery books with cheesy titles. Steve’s catching up on a word search app. 

The last kiss at night. When they’re both in bed and Tony yawns for the first time. Steve will shut off the lamp. 

“You don’t have to go to bed, dear.” 

“I know, but you’re sleepy. And besides, going to bed with you is never too bad.” He gets one last kiss. 

“Love you always, Tony.” 

“Love you forever, Steve.” 

(It is a pretty good kiss. The words just add.)

But when they’re alone, Steve will talk a bit. Just a few compliments here and there. Some fun little anecdotes about his day. Tony loves it, honestly. He doesn’t tell Steve he does, just hums and works his way around.  

The kisses are always spread out over the day, never at once. That’s how they prefer it. 

It starts in the morning. Steve wakes Tony up at six in the morning–a shitty time, but Tony does put up with it for kisses–and he says “Good morning, love. I’m going on my run, I’ll text you when I’m coming back.” And then kiss. Tony likes it. 

He can’t go back to sleep, and he loves to make breakfast. So he’ll usually get started on Steve’s breakfast, which is basically cooking for two. Four slices of toast, four eggs, two strips of bacon, (he’s not making more, Steve doesn’t need that much) and a bowl of fruit. He also makes coffee, which is more for him. 

At around six forty, Steve will come back, shower, and drop a kiss on Tony’s temple. 

“Run was good. I got to pet three dogs.” 

“More than yesterday, babe, good for you.” Steve grins, nabbing his plate. “No more bacon?” 

“No more bacon,” Tony says. “If I have to watch what I’m eating, so do you. Besides, you know you can make more, lazy bones.” Steve rolls his eyes. He pours the coffee for Tony, with the required tablespoon of cream and another of sugar. 

The next kiss is when Steve drops by SI on his lunch break. The new PA, Gilda, lets him in with no thought. Just waves him through. 

“Missed you,” Steve says. “Brought lunch.” Usually, it’s something he made before he went to work. Sometimes it’s something from a shop that Tony likes. Either way, wonderful. 

“I saw you at breakfast.” 

“And yet, not until lunch. Time differences, babe.” Tony likes the pet names. Steve lives for them. He uses the usual ones–honey, babe, sweetheart, darling, love, all of that. Tony loves it. It means more to him than he knows, perhaps because Steve doesn’t say things unless he really means them. 

Lunch passes quickly, with Steve being late and the suit ruffled a little bit always. Natasha says she and Maria always make fun of him. 

Next kiss is usually a text from either of them. Both love their work, and so Steve may be staying thirty minutes later or Tony will. (They set a limit, obviously. Whether or not it’s actually followed is usually up to the urgency.) Steve or Tony will text that they’re late, a kiss at the end. Still nice, if a bit artificial. 

Dinnertime is Steve’s time to cook. He loves doing it. He usually sets Dean Martin’s music up, singing alone to the music as Tony teases him over the pronunciation of some of the Italian. Steve gets a kiss and a question about work. 

“Work is fine, just working with new recruits,” Steve says. “Some of ‘em are really nice, so I’m sending them Hill’s way.” 

“You can see her name, Steve. Just because she likes to act like she knows all doesn’t mean she does.” 

“She knows about the incident of us and office room J.” 

“Shit.” 

Steve laughs, shaking out some more seasoning for the meat. He hums along to some Sinatra as he drops the broccoli onto the cutting board. 

“What do you want me to do, honey?” 

“Nothing,” Steve says. “Nothing except give me a kiss. You got breakfast. I got dinner.” 

“And you get me lunch. You technically get two meals, which means I have to make it up somehow.” 

“Love doesn’t get made up, it just exists,” Steve reminds him, dropping another kiss on him. “And you are by far the best existence to me.” Tony snorts, rolling his eyes. 

“You geek, quit being so sappy. People might think we’re in love or something.” 

“Oh we’ve had no idea!” Bruce calls from the hallway. “No idea that you two are the grossest married couple in existence!” Steve lets out a bellowing laugh, head thrown back. 

“Thanks Bruce!” he yells back. 

They eat dinner together, talking about the rest of their day. Tony had a couple of international meetings which went well. Tony’s working on renewable energy for other countries, running into some problem with oil companies and zoning. 

“Want me to fight the oil companies?” Steve says. “I can do that.” Tony laughs. 

“As much as I would love that, I don’t want to bail you out of jail. Besides, we have a movie premiere to go to next week, and you still need to get fitted for the suit.” Steve makes a noise of disapproval. 

“Why can’t I just wear one from my closet? I doubt people would notice if it was the same black one.” 

“This one is a bit more…daring. How do you feel about purple?” 

“…interested. Fitting tomorrow then? I’m off work at two.” 

“Definitely.” 

The rest of the night is pretty boring, as far as nights go. Tony listens to a message Peter sent him about his Spider-Man patrol, and Steve texts Bucky about the mission he’s on. It must not be too high-stakes, because he sends snapchat videos of Clint dancing to Whitney Houston in the middle of a blizzard. 

“They’re both ridiculous,” Tony says. He’s wearing readers while he has one of his cheesy books with him. He and Pepper have a reading group, and right now they’re on murder-mystery books with cheesy titles. Steve’s catching up on a word search app. 

The last kiss at night. When they’re both in bed and Tony yawns for the first time. Steve will shut off the lamp. 

“You don’t have to go to bed, dear.” 

“I know, but you’re sleepy. And besides, going to bed with you is never too bad.” He gets one last kiss. 

“Love you always, Tony.” 

“Love you forever, Steve.” 

(It is a pretty good kiss. The words just add.)
